intro: Sessea corymbiflora, commonly known as the Madagascar starwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers clustered in corymbs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
